intro: Stemodia arvensis, commonly known as fieldstemodia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is an annual herb with slender, branched stems that often grow close to the ground. The plant has small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a slightly hairy surface. Stemodia arvensis is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural areas.
